basics.name: Teghan Nightengale
basics.label: Senior Engineer
basics.summary: I am a recognized expert on building performant and cost-effective data platforms for medium sized startups. I have a strong background in Data Engineering and DevOps, including streaming systems, eventing, data pipelines (ELT/ETL), data architecture, and data analysis, and have worked with a variety of cloud providers and data tools. I am passionate about building data platforms that are easy to use, easy to maintain, and easy to scale.

work.name: Felix Health
work.summary: Built the data platform for inference and analytics, advising the Head of Data and VP of Engineering on best frameworks and tooling, while leading implementation across the org.

work.name: Community.com
work.summary: Owned the data platform encompassing data ops, financial reporting and customer billing, ML integrations, external APIs and metadata management.

work.name: Community.com
work.summary: Architected and built the data analytics platform at Community using Snowflake, dbt-Core, Terraform, Docker, Looker.

work.name: Ritual.co
work.summary: Led migration of our data pipelines off of GCP and onto Snowflake. Built out our data lakehouse architecture and implemented dbt for data modeling.

work.name: Ritual.co
work.summary: Worked on a mission-critical team to identify new restaurants for onboarding, across 7 countries. Ever scraped Chinese 'Yelp'? I have.

work.name: Various Companies
work.summary: Worked with various medium-sized privately held firms on contracts to build internal data tooling, apps, and analytics infrastructure.

work.name: Queen's University
work.summary: Oversaw the Queen’s makerspace, SparQ Studios, and worked on self-directed initiatives to improve the innovation community at Queen’s University, while consulting on projects for various start-ups.

work.name: Kingston Rowing Club
work.summary: Organized and led programs for experienced and recreational rowers, while managing a team of junior coaches.

volunteer.summary: Helped faciliate the Toronto Concert Orchestra's summer concert series at Casa Loma.

volunteer.position: SKIP (Seniors and Kids Intergenerational Program) Volunteer, 2010-2011
volunteer.summary: Visited with retirees weekly to talk, learn, and play bridge.
